communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Entergy Texts with Hugh McDonald
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All text messages between Secretary Hugh McDonald and Danny Games.

This request should search professional accounts and any personal accounts used for professional purposes.

Please include any administrative assistant(s) and chiefs of staff that may report to the named individual.

The timeframe of this public records request is between January 1, 2024 through July 28, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Daniel Tait.

title: Untitled (U.s. Army Human Resources Command, Fort Knox, Ky 40122)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Military Service Record (Amedd Record Processing Center)
Mail

To Whom It May Concern:
Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:
A releasable copy of the Official Military Personnel File of PVT, Julius O. Pearse, date of birth Jul 6, 1933, which should include: Name, Service Number, Dates of Service, Branch of Service, Final Duty Status, Final Rank, Assignments and Geographical locations, Military Education Level, Awards and Decorations, Photograph, Transcripts of Courts-Martial Trial, and place of entrance and separation
I would also like a releasable copy of PVT Julius O. Pearse's Official Personnel Folder which should include: past and present positions, past and present titles, past and present salaries, past and present grades, past and present job locations
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Julius Otto Pearse

title: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Sharon Walsh and Michelle Lofwall

communications.subject: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Sharon Walsh and Michelle Lofwall
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All emails of Sharon Walsh (sharon.walsh@uky.edu) and Michelle Lofwall (michelle.lofwall@uky.edu) from January 2019 until today, July 29th, 2024. Please include all attachments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wes Anderson

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any policy manual, employee procedure manual, or folder of collected policies which guide police operations. This may be one document with many policies, or all policies collected.

The original format of the documents is acceptable (PDF, .doc, .txt, etc).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jesse Wozniak

communications.communication:
Hello,
All Right-To-Know requests must be submitted through the Township's online
Records Request Center. To access the Records Request Center, see link
below.

https://www.twpusc.org/departments/police/police_forms.php

Respectfully,

Upper St. Clair Police Department

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Steve Collins Disciplinary Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The full and complete content of every Seattle Fire Department  investigative and/or disciplinary file for former SFD employee Steve Collins, along with associated metadata.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Fire - General :: C191221-072824
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Welcome to the City of Seattle Public Records Request Center (PRRC). Your request was received on July 28, 2024 and is appended below. 
 
The reference number for this request is C191221-072824. You will see this number in the title of any communications about this request. 
 
You will hear from a Public Disclosure Officer within five business days regarding the status of your request. 
 
Please visit the City of Seattle Public Records Request Center where you can manage your profile and access your request. Your login ID is: 170405-81685893@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If a Public Disclosure Officer submitted your public disclosure request into the PRRC on your behalf, please login and complete your new user account by following these steps: 
 
  * Access the Public Records Request Center 
  * Select 'Forgot my Password' 
  * Enter your 'Login ID' (email address) 
  * A temporary password will be sent to you via email 
  * Login with the temporary password 
You may now visit the PRRC 'My Records Request Center' anytime! 
 
Request C191221-072824:  
" To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The full and complete content of every Seattle Fire Department investigative and/or disciplinary file for former SFD employee Steve Collins, along with associated metadata.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fseattle-fire-department-18127%252Fsteve-collins-disciplinary-records-170405%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AABfPylg8I-eETibmjYs8kdTZw8%3A1sYFfV%3AALUbvLofq2F4hdVSO71CQlMTjn43FM2MoTVL48T7DAs"

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Policy documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any policy manual, employee procedure manual, or folder of collected policies which guide police operations. 

The original format of the documents is acceptable (i.e. PDF, doc, .txt, etc).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian Barr

Betsy Rengers

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any policy manual, employee procedure manual, or folder of collected policies which guide police operations. 

The original format of the documents is acceptable (i.e. PDF, doc, .txt, etc).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian Barr

communications.subject: RE: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Policy Documents
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

All Right-To-Know Requests must be submitted with proper documentation before the request will be addressed.

Please submit a Right-To-Know Request form, see attached document.

Thank you.


Karen F. Fosbaugh
Township Manager
SOUTH PARK TOWNSHIP
2675 Brownsville Road
South Park, PA  15129
412-831-7000

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: County of Marin
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All contracts between the County of Marin Contract and Reed Smith LLP currently in effect

All invoices from Reed Smith LLP to County of Marin in 2023

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robbie Powelson

communications.subject: Your County of Marin, CA public records request #24-462 has been opened.
communications.communication:
County of Marin, CA ************************************************************************ Your record request #24-462 has been submitted successfully. Please be advised that County staff have received your CPRA request. Within the next 10 days, we will determine whether your request seeks copies of disclosable records in the County's possession or whether the County will require an extension. ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact County of Marin, CA.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center

communications.subject: [ACTION REQUIRED] Your County of Marin, CA public records portal account
communications.communication:
Use this to confirm your account. The link is only valid for 24 hours.

County of Marin, CA

************************************************************************
Hello Robbie Powelson!
************************************************************************

You can confirm your County of Marin, CA public records portal account by copying and pasting the URL below into your web browser. This link is only valid for the next 24 hours.

Magic link: https://marincountyca.nextrequest.com/users/confirmation?confirmation_token=aLM91VHy-Kj7v8Vkx7Bh



************************************************************************                          
Questions? Check out our help page (https://www.nextrequest.com/support) or email us at support@nextrequest.com.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: DOL-DHS VWP Coordination
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All communications between the Department of Labor and the Department of Homeland Security regarding U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement's Voluntary Work Program from January 1, 2017 to the present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: Your PAL account is ready
communications.communication:
Dear Andrew Free, 

You've successfully created a PAL account. You will receive another email with a link to create your password. 

Username: 170348-99418381@requests.muckrock.com 

Any previously submitted requests to DOL FOIA have been saved to your profile.
Regards, 
DOL FOIA

communications.communication:

The tracking number 2024-F-12780 has been assigned to the request you submitted. In all future correspondence regarding this request please reference the tracking number 2024-F-12780.
Regards, 
DOL FOIA

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Use of Force Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

I request,
1.) Disaggregated data for all use of force incidents for the Sangamon County Sheriff's Office  in structured, tabular, or original database format (.csv, .txt, .xml, or .xsl), from January 1, 2020, through the date of this request
2.) A code list for the complaints, data dictionary, or definitions for any variables with coded responses.  
3.) Additionally, I request detailed or written reports for incidents involving Officer Sear Patrick Grayson. 

If any part of my request cannot be granted, please proceed with the remainder of the request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian Barr

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Voluntary Recognitions for Quarter 2, 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to determine the number of voluntary employee union recognitions from April 01, 2024 through June 30, 2024. If available, please provide records about individual recognition with such fields as employer, location, description of bargaining unit, union, and size of unit, and any other non-exempt fields on Form NLRB-5581.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Forest Gregg
